result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey M. SCHERER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Judith Engelbrecht at 910 South 39th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.

Submit a DNA sample.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Write apology letter to Judith Engelbrecht to be approved by the agent before it is mailed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

records.addlTxt: Plea date on June 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Order Reducing Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the cash bail of $1,000.00 shall be reduced to $500.00 cash. All other conditions of bond remain in full force and effect.
Cover letter.
Copy to jail.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy filed.

Attorney Engstrom is requesting the cash bail set in each case be converted to signature bonds.  Defendant would also be willing to have a condition of a daily report date.
State objects to the request and presents arguments.
Court believes cash bail is appropriate and modifies the $1,000.00 cash bonds in 15 CF 667 and 15 CF 668 to $500.00 cash and continues the $500.00 cash bond in 15 CF 669.  Conditions remain the same.
Attorney Engstrom is directed to prepare the Order.
Minutes.

Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 12-09-15 at 9:30 a.m.   
Minutes.
Ann Larson, public defender.
RE:  Judith Engelbrecht, on 11-18-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of theft and misappropriate ID information.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with Harold G. Toms, Nathan C. Korinek or 2314 Marshall Street, Manitowoc, WI and Judith A. Engelbrecht or 910 S. 39th Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Minutes.
